tools.name: resolve_cert_chain
tools.comment:
resolves a single X509 certificate chain from file or base64 data.
// Used for building complete certificate chains from leaf certificates.
tools.description: Resolve X509 certificate chain from a certificate file or base64-encoded certificate data
tools.roleComment:
handles single certificate chain resolution operations.
// Responsible for building complete certificate chains from leaf certificates.

params.name: certificate
params.description: Certificate file path or base64-encoded certificate data

params.name: include_system_root
params.description: Include system root CA in output (default: false)

tools.name: validate_cert_chain
tools.comment:
validates a certificate chain for correctness and trust.
// Performs comprehensive chain validation including signature verification and trust path validation.
tools.description: Validate a X509 certificate chain for correctness and trust
tools.roleComment:
performs certificate chain validation and trust verification.
// Ensures certificate chains meet security and correctness requirements.

params.name: certificate
params.description: Certificate file path or base64-encoded certificate data

params.name: include_system_root
params.description: Include system root CA for validation (default: true)

tools.name: batch_resolve_cert_chain
tools.comment:
processes multiple certificate chains in a single operation.
// Optimizes performance for bulk certificate processing scenarios.
tools.description: Resolve X509 certificate chains for multiple certificates in batch
tools.roleComment:
manages bulk certificate chain processing operations.
// Optimizes performance for high-volume certificate processing scenarios.

params.name: certificates
params.description: Comma-separated list of certificate file paths or base64-encoded certificate data

params.name: include_system_root
params.description: Include system root CA in output (default: false)

tools.name: check_cert_expiry
tools.comment:
monitors certificate expiration dates with configurable warning thresholds.
// Essential for certificate lifecycle management and renewal planning.
tools.description: Check certificate expiry dates and warn about upcoming expirations
tools.roleComment:
monitors certificate expiration dates and renewal requirements.
// Critical for certificate lifecycle management and preventing outages.

params.name: certificate
params.description: Certificate file path or base64-encoded certificate data

params.name: warn_days
params.description: Number of days before expiry to show warning (default: 30)

tools.name: fetch_remote_cert
tools.comment:
retrieves certificate chains from remote TLS endpoints.
// Enables analysis of server certificates without local file access.
tools.description: Fetch X509 certificate chain from a remote hostname/port
tools.roleComment:
retrieves certificate chains from remote TLS endpoints.
// Enables analysis of server certificates without requiring local file access.

params.name: include_system_root
params.description: Include system root CA in output (default: false)

tools.name: analyze_certificate_with_ai
tools.comment:
performs advanced certificate analysis using AI collaboration.
// Provides security assessments, compliance checks, and actionable recommendations.
tools.description: Analyze certificate data using AI collaboration (requires bidirectional communication)
tools.roleComment:
performs advanced certificate analysis using AI collaboration.
// Provides intelligent security assessments and actionable recommendations.

params.name: certificate
params.description: Certificate file path or base64-encoded certificate data to analyze

tools.name: get_resource_usage
tools.comment:
provides server resource usage statistics and CRL cache metrics.
// Includes memory usage, GC statistics, and performance monitoring data.
tools.description: Get current resource usage statistics including memory, GC, and CPU information
tools.roleComment:
tracks server resource usage and performance metrics.
// Provides insights into memory usage, GC statistics, and CRL cache efficiency.
